intro: Plantago australis subsp. sodiroana, commonly known as the New Zealand plantain, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a spike, which are borne on a tall stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, riverbanks, and coastal areas. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability and ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
